meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>descend</kanji>, but this word means something closer to <vocabulary>to fall</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to come down</vocabulary>. Usually used with things like rain or snow.
readingMnemonic: The rain is <vocabulary>to fall</vocabulary> and you're outside anyway with your mouth open so you'll get a mouth <reading>full</reading> (ふる) of rainwater! All the ponds, wells, and your yard will be full of water too!
